Summary Electrical Engineer with 8 years of experience in the field of automation and control for thermal electronic systems. Software development for System on Chip (SoC) products validation using complex test equipment. 
 
Registered as an Engineer In Training (EIT) with the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Canada.  
 
Positive individual with excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills and ability to work effectively in a multicultural environment using strategic thinking and advanced problem solving techniques to drive solutions to a wide range of theoretical and practical problems, which require a high degree of innovation and ingenuity. 
 
Hardware Development Skills: 
	Analog and digital circuitry design from concept - schematic P&R to PCB prototype to full high volume production. 
	Production PCB integration and validation on complex SoC testing equipment. 
	Customer long term professional support for integrated products. 
	Lab tools such as oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, power supplies and soldering equipment. 
	Communication protocols (USB, I2C, SMBUS). 
 
Software Development Skills: 
	Hardware Design Software: Cadence OrCAD, PSPISE, Allegro PCB, Virtuoso P&R. 
	Programming Languages: C++, Assembler, Perl, Visual Basic, VHDL, UNIX. 
	Writing Firmware code for Microchip Microcontrollers. 
 
General Skills: 
	Excellent documentation skills.  
	Optimizing validation flows and testing methods on production floor.  
	Ability to identify cost reduction opportunities through improving operational efficiencies.  
	Improving testing software and environment in order to save testing time.  
	Strong project management skills and collaboration work to meet the project goals using LEAN regulated manufacturing methodology. 
	Developing test procedures and evaluating component suppliers.
